title: 'Daredevil' Introduces Bernthal's Punisher at NYCC
text:
'Daredevil' Introduces Bernthal's Punisher at NYCC By Michael Rothman Oct 10, 2015, 7:47 PM ET 0 Shares Star marvel/Instagram Marvel posted this photo to their Instagram on Oct. 11, 2014 with the caption, "You're looking at the first official photos of Charlie Cox as Matt Murdock in #Marvel's #Daredevil, coming to@Netflix." 0 Shares Email We didn't see the classic skull uniform that only the Punisher wears so well, but "Daredevil" did give fans a look at Jon Bernthal's Frank Castle during New York Comic Con . The assumption is Castle won't become Punisher until later in the season anyway, but in a season 2 teaser, we get a look at the former "Walking Dead" star becoming the vigilante Marvel fans know and love. Read: 'Pretty Little Liars:' 5 Things the Cast Revealed at New York Comic-Con About the New Season Ryan Penagos, executive editorial director at Marvel Digital, was live-tweeting the NYCC "Daredevil" panel and described what Netflix released in the clip. "It was a pretty epic sizzle of #Daredevil season one and then a tease of season 2! Elektra! Frank Castle! DD costume! #MarvelNYCC," he wrote. "'You wanted grounded, you wanted dark. Here's Elektra. Here's Punisher.'" Marco Ramirez #Daredevil #MarvelNYCC." Bernthal didn't have much to say in the clip, but "Beg!" can be heard and "Vindication. Your work is not yet finished." You also see him walking the halls of what looks like a hospital. 
They played #Daredevil Season 2 teaser again. We only hear Punisher say one word: “Beg.” #NYCC — Eric Goldman (@TheEricGoldman) October 10, 2015 
"I know how important this character is to you guys. I know how important this show is." @jonnybernthal #Punisher #Daredevil #MarvelNYCC
